title: [Self-Directed] Designing Learning Engagement and Co-Creation of Value in Online Science Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science education theory and experience in operating online learning platforms
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers conducting projects to design online learning environments in the field of science.

learning_goals: Cultivation of data collection and analysis skills using a four-dimensional (behavioral, cognitive, emotional, social) online learning engagement measurement tool.

Learners will analyze causal relationships between learning engagement factors (five variables, e.g., lecture interest, peer interaction) and motivation (intrinsic/extrinsic) using structural equation modeling (SEM) tools (AMOS, R lavaan, etc.), and prepare a report including path coefficients (Î²) and model fit indices (CFI > 0.9, RMSEA < 0.08).
Enhancement of the ability to establish value co-creation strategies when designing online science projects that consider diverse learner characteristics.
Cultivating the ability to propose improvements for online learning environments reflecting formative assessment results
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
